result.execSummary:
All charges against Aleisha Lyndell Downey in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aleisha Lyndell Downey is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:48 PM Cases 22CF84 and 22CF85 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aleisha Lyndell Downey in court.  Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court for Aleisha Lyndell Downey.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  State assures VR compliance.  Atty Harrington files PLQ in court.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Harrington: def pleading Guilty to Cts 1, 2, and 5 (State adding second count of possess burglary tools as Count 5 party to a crime) of 22CF85; dismissing 22CF84 outright, request PSI, parties free to argue.  State provides basis for agreement, moves to amend information on the record to add Count 5 as stated.  Court grants proposed amendment to add Count 5 possess burglary tools to 22CF85.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, and 5 of 22CF85 and orders a JOC; 22CF84 is dismissed outright.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Bond continues.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Test results
Test results

No use or possession of burglarious tools.  No contact with victims, their residences, or businesses.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  In lieu of additional cash bond, defendant must be on an electronic monitor through Burnett County Justice Coordinator at defendant's cost of $215 per month; defendant will need to deposit 30 days in advance.  Bond amendments and defendant's subsequent release from custody are to be effective upon quashing of the Bayfield County warrant and the defendant being hooked up on electronic monitor.  Defendant is subject to a curfew from 8 pm-7 am; defendant must reside with her father.

10:38 AM Cases 22CF84 and 22CF85 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aleisha Lyndell Downey in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court for Aleisha Lyndell Downey.  Cases on for bail/bond hearing.  Court makes record of Bayfield County warrant, which is still active.  Atty Harrington notes communication w/ def's atty in Bayfield Cty matters.  Atty Harrington asks motion to be granted subject to warrant in Bayfield being lifted.  State responds, wants electronic monitoring if def is released.  State assures VR compliance.  Court amends bond to $1,000 cash.  Discussion of house arrest/curfew.  Atty Harrington notes PLQ has been prepared but not yet signed due to circumstances, will sign it on the plea date.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:05 AM Cases 22CF84 and 22CF85 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aleisha Lyndell Downey in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court for Aleisha Lyndell Downey. Cases on for Status Conference.  Court notes an untimely motion was filed for bond modification.  Defense attorney updates the Court: cases are resolved- case 22CF84 will be dismissed (ct 1 outright, cts 2 and 3 DRI) State to amend 22CF85 to allege 2 counts of possession of burglary tools and 1 count possession of methamphetamine- def to plead to those 3 counts, PSI requested, parties free to argue.  Court asks for basis for the amendments/modifications requested.  State lays basis for agreement.  Atty Harrington argues in support of agreement and bond modification.  State responds to bond motion- not objecting to bond modification, requests some cash, electronic monitor, and conditions to ensure her appearance.  Court makes record.  Atty Harrington responds.   Court would not release def without an electronic monitor.  Off the record 11:19 AM.  Back on the record 11:23 AM, same appearances.  Atty Harrington indicated the defendant's family could post $1000.  Justice Coordinator is unavailable today to find out if a monitor can be arranged.  State responds to potential modification- with monitor and $1000 and condition def can't leave the state, satisfied.  Court advises monitor fees would be $18/day at def's cost.  Bayfield County warrant would need to be taken care of prior to next hearing.  Discussion of dental plan.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:38 AM Cases 22CF84 and 22CF85 called together.  Defendant Aleisha Lyndell Downey in court with attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: Defendant is withdrawing the speedy trial demand, reviewing discovery, have a basis for a resolution, offer has recently changed- needs time to resolve, confident both cases will resolve.  June and July trials will be removed from the calendar, requesting another STC.  FPT converted to STC.  Atty Harrington makes record RE: dental and healthcare issue. 10:28 AM Cases 22CF84 and 22CF85 called together.  Defendant Aleisha Lyndell Downey in court with attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin. Cases set for preliminary hearings, but atty Harrington indicated off the record that def wants to waive.  Cases proceed to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waivers of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files informations mirroring complaints.  Atty Harringon preserves jurisdictional reservation.  Cases proceed to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Harrington argues in support of his bond motion to convert to signature bond.  Atty Schmidt argues against bond modification.  Court denies bond modification.  Atty Harrington notes def demands speedy trial.  STC, FPT, and JT12s scheduled.  FPT/drop-dead date explained to def.  Court notes case 22CF84 will be #1 on that date; 22CF85 will be #2.  Discussion of consolidation.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

02:20 PM Called 22CF84 & 22CF85 for INIT.  Defendant Aleisha Lyndell Downey in court with attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Defendant in custody.  DA James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  All in person.  Both cases on for Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG on misdemeanors in both cases, and request PH in both cases.  In waiving the reading Attny Harrington would preserve jurisdictional defect to the complaints, potential basis for a Frank's motion. Court grants right to reserve that as can't get discovery until after ARGN.  Waives reading.  Def confirms contact info is correct.  NG pleas entered on your behalf on misdemeanors.  Request PH within time limits. Bond continues.  Attny may file ahead to request a bail modification for next court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
